11173Russian Journal of Coordination ChemistryRuss J Coord Chem1070-32841608-3318SP MAIK Nauka/InterperiodicaDordrechtS1070328413050084959610.1134/S1070328413050084ArticleSynthesis, crystal structure, and luminescent property of a new two-dimensional Cd(II) coordination polymer based on 1,10-phenanthroline and dicarboxylateXuZ. L.19596XuN.29596HeYu19596KongZ. G.19596dZhangJ. J.19596grid.440799.7Key Laboratory of Preparation and Applications of Environmental Friendly Materials, Ministry of Education, College of ChemistryJilin Normal University136000SipingP.R. Chinagrid.411510.00000000403867523School of Chemical & Environmental EngineeringChina University of Mining & Technology100083BeijingP.R. Chinakongzhiguo1977@yahoo.com.cn952013520133954114147520132292011952013© Pleiades Publishing, Ltd. 20132013Abstract

A novel Cd(II) coordination polymers based on 2-(2-fluorophenyl)-1H-imidazo[4,5-f] [1,10]phenanthroline (L) and 1,4-naphthalenedicarboxylate (1,4-NDC), namely, [Cd2(L)2(1,4-NDC)2] · H2O (I), has been successfully synthesized under hydrothermal conditions. Its structure has been determined by single crystal X-ray diffraction analysis. Complex I crystallizes in monoclinic system, space group P21/n, with lattice parameters a = 12.474(2), b = 15.002(3), c = 13.766(3) Å, β = 98.45(4)°, V = 2548.1(8) Å3, Z = 2, and ρcalcd = 1.694 mg m−3. Compound I shows a two-dimensional (2D) layer structure. The neighboring layers are linked by π-π interactions to form a 3D supramolecular architecture. In addition, the luminescent property of the compound has also been investigated in solid state at room temperature.

Its structure has been determined by single crystal X-ray diffraction analysis. Complex I crystallizes in monoclinic system, space group P21/n, with lattice parameters a = 12.474(2), b = 15.002(3), c = 13.766(3) Å, β = 98.45(4)°, V = 2548.1(8) Å3, Z = 2, and ρcalcd = 1.694 mg m−3. Compound I shows a two-dimensional (2D) layer structure. The neighboring layers are linked by π-π interactions to form a 3D supramolecular architecture. In addition, the luminescent property of the compound has also been investigated in solid state at room temperature.

Abstract

A novel Cd(II) coordination polymers based on 2-(2-fluorophenyl)-1H-imidazo[4,5-f] [1,10]phenanthroline (L) and 1,4-naphthalenedicarboxylate (1,4-NDC), namely, [Cd2(L)2(1,4-NDC)2] ⋅ H2O (I), has been successfully synthesized under hydrothermal conditions. Its structure has been determined by single crystal X-ray diffraction analysis. Complex I crystallizes in monoclinic system, space group P21/n, with lattice parameters a = 12.474(2), b = 15.002(3), c = 13.766(3) Å, β = 98.45(4)°, V = 2548.1(8) Å3, Z = 2, and ρcalcd = 1.694 mg m-3. Compound I shows a two-dimensional (2D) layer structure. The neighboring layers are linked by π-π interactions to form a 3D supramolecular architecture. In addition, the luminescent property of the compound has also been investigated in solid state at room temperature.

Abstract

A novel Cd(II) coordination polymers based on 2-(2-fluorophenyl)-1H-imidazo[4,5-f] [1,10]phenanthroline (L) and 1,4-naphthalenedicarboxylate (1,4-NDC), namely, [Cd2(L)2(1,4-NDC)2] ⋅ H2O (I), has been successfully synthesized under hydrothermal conditions. Compound I shows a two-dimensional (2D) layer structure. The neighboring layers are linked by π-π interactions to form a 3D supramolecular architecture. metadata.title: Synthesis, crystal structure, and luminescent property of a new two-dimensional Cd(II) coordination polymer based on 1,10-phenanthroline and dicarboxylate
